title: A man buys 10 pens at the rate of 11 for rupees 10 and sell them at 10 for 11 to earn Rs. 42 profit. How many pens did he buy? - Quora

response.answer_text: Ans We have C.P of 10 pens = (10/11) ×10= 100/11Rs S.P of 10 pens = (11/10) ×10 = 11Rs Profit = S.P - C.P = 11 - 100/11 =(121–100) /11=21/11 Now applying unitary method If profit is Rs 21/11 then no. of pens = 10 If profit is 1 then no. of pens = 10/(21/11) = Rs 110/21 If profit is Rs 42 then no. of pens = (110/21) ×42 = 220 Hence Answer is = 220 pens

Cost Price of 1- pen = Rs 10/11Sale Price of 1- pen = Rs 11/10So Profit for 1- pen = (11/10–10/11)(121–100)/110 = 21/110.Number of pens to be sold to get a Profit of Rs 42= 42÷(21/110)= 42 x 110/21= 220
